intro: Aciotis asplundii, commonly known as the Mexican dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, which are dispersed by the wind. Aciotis asplundii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
